name: Bard
shortDescription: Charismatic performers who weave magic through music, words, and inspiration.
description: Bards are masters of song, speech, and magic. They use performance and wit to inspire allies, confound enemies, and subtly shape the world around them.

spellcasting.description: Bards cast spells through music and performance. They know a limited number of spells and can cast any known spell using spell slots.

features.name: Bardic Inspiration
features.description: You can inspire others through stirring words or music. As a bonus action, grant a creature within 60 feet a Bardic Inspiration die (d6). The creature can add it to an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: You gain the ability to cast bard spells using Charisma as your spellcasting ability.

features.name: Jack of All Trades
features.description: You can add half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) to any ability check you make that doesnâ€™t already include your proficiency bonus.

features.name: Song of Rest
features.description: During a short rest, you and friendly creatures regain extra hit points when spending Hit Dice (d6).

subclass.label: Bard College
subclass.description: Choose a bardic college that shapes the style of your magic and performance.

features.name: Expertise
features.description: Choose two skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make with them.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: Increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1.

features.name: Bardic Inspiration Improvement
features.description: Your Bardic Inspiration die becomes a d8, and Bardic Inspiration now refreshes on a short rest.

features.name: Countercharm
features.description: You can use musical performance to grant advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed.
